title: Create a new deployment for OO in EKS
content:
You can use the cdfctl.sh script provided by Optic Management Toolkit (OMT) to create a new deployment. This deployment contains a namespace, default certificate and service account used by Helm when installing the OO chart.

To view more options for the cdfctl.sh script, run ./cdfctl.sh deployment -h
  1. Log in to the bastion node and navigate to the OMT installation directory: 
    cd OMT_External_K8s_2x.x-xxx/scripts/
  2. Run the following command to create the deployment: 
    ./cdfctl.sh deployment create -d <OO DEPLOYMENT NAME> [-n <OO NAMESPACE>]
    The -n option is optional. If you don't specify this option, a namespace that uses the deployment name you specified for the -d option gets created. However, you can specify the -n option if you want to use a custom namespace.

    For example: 
    ./cdfctl.sh deployment create -d oo

    A message that resembles the following indicates that you have installed the application deployment successfully. 
    INF Creating deployment ... name=<OO DEPLOYMENT NAME> namespace=<OO NAMESPACE>
INF Created namespace "<OO NAMESPACE>" ...
INF Successfully created deployment "<OO DEPLOYMENT NAME>" uuid=<UUID>

View the installed deployments

Run the following command on the bastion node to view the installed applications:

cd OMT_External_K8s_2x.x-xxx/scripts/cdfctl.sh deployment get


Your terminal resembles the following:

UUID     NAME                   NAMESPACE          STATUS   TYPE
<UUID>   <OO DEPLOYMENT NAME>   <OO NAMESPACE>     OK       SECONDARY
